title: Bring Stacking Devourer Back.
body:
Pros:
1.It was not abused by the pros.
2.it brought diversity to the jungle.
3.it gave a reason for players to play champions that dont have burst damage in the jungle.
4.it encouraged taking objectives.
5.It made some champions viable (jax jungle,xin jungle,kindred jungle,shyvana jungle,ww jungle,kayle)

Cons:
1.it encouraged overstaying in the jungle.
2.it made games more snowbally for some champions(if you lose you cant stack,if you win you stack too fast)
Right now with the current jungle timers the item seems more viable than ever.

All I remember, is that the community wouldn't shut up about the item. Also, I'm a bit confused. Are we talking the infinity stacking Devourer or the sated one? You mentioned in the Op "Stacking" but your reference to Rageblade suggests the sated one. (FYI it has since been reduced to 6 stacks) 

The biggest problem I saw with the infinity stacking was the AFK farming that was a result. Problematic in a Deveourer vs Devourer match up, as who ever stops farming first, will basically lose. 

And with sated, I think it was just hard for them to be shut down. (Given the power you get once sated) And despite the fact that it only really worked against jungle camps, it still seemed too subjected to lane abuse at lower ELO. 

I'm not saying I didn't enjoy the item when we had it, I just don't think Bringing it back is going to fly.
